node.title: Vault Gallery Photography Exhibit
node.full_body: “All Around You” is the latest art exhibit to arrive at the Downtown Phoenix campus Library’s Vault Gallery for the Fall 2021 semester. A collection of images by local photographer Julia Letcher, the exhibit features close-up photographs of bees and flowers in addition to Arizona landscapes.Letcher, who became interested in photography at a young age, asks the rhetorical question: “Who wouldn’t want to be a photographer if they were an Arizona native?” Growing up in Arizona, she says, has given her the greatest opportunity to photograph – everything from wide open desert scenes to small-scale insects.“It has always been extremely important to me, as a photographer, to look around, taking in the beauty of my current surroundings,” says Letcher. “The world around us has been more interesting to me to photograph rather than people. There is beauty everywhere.”The exhibit will be on display until early December.
node.event_topics: Easy on the wallet|Open to the public|Learn something

node.title: With the Flow of the Hand
node.college_unit: ASU Library, ASU Library - Collections, School of Music, Dance and Theatre
node.full_body: A new exhibit at the Music Library on the Tempe campus features a collection of 11 signed opera scores — all first and early editions — by Wagner, Rossini, Verdi, Massenet, Puccini, Poulenc, Hahn, Thomas, Saint-Saëns and Gounod.The signed opera scores are from the collection of ASU faculty member Robert Mills, a clinical assistant professor of music and the vocal coach/accompanist for ASU’s Lyric Opera Theater, part of the School of Music, Dance and Theatre, within the Herberger Institute for Design and the Arts.These autographs and inscriptions serve as physical reminders in our modern world of quintessential opera composers from the 19th and 20th centuries. Included in the collection is a rare signed first edition of Richard Wagner’s Das Rheingold with an inscription to the 19th century poet Mathilde Wesendonck with whom he had a brief but scandalous affair. Another noteworthy score in the collection is a presentation copy of Reynaldo Hahn’s La Carmélite to Jules Massenet, his teacher and mentor. This exhibit will be on display in the Music Library, part of the ASU Library, from August 19 to December 20. For further information, please contact Robert Mills at robert.mills@asu.edu or Linda Elsasser at linda.elsasser@asu.edu

node.title: Personal Financial Consultations with Fidelity
node.full_body: Meet with a financial consultant from Fidelity virtually or over the phone. Receive free, personalized advice, guidance and support to help make informed decisions regarding the following: Adequate investing to retire at the desired age.Appropriate investing based on risk tolerance. Converting investments into steady income after retirement.Meeting financial goals in retirement.Schedule an appointment online or call 800-642-7131.

node.title: Leo Villareal, 'Point Cloud (ASU)'
node.college_unit: ASU Art Museum, Herberger Institute for Design and the Arts
node.full_body: “Point Cloud (ASU)” is a newly commissioned artwork by Leo Villareal designed specifically for the ASU Art Museum in the Nelson Fine Arts Center. During his visit to the ASU Art Museum, Villareal was inspired by the museum’s architecture, designed by Antoine Predock in 1987. Villareal used mobile 3D scan technology to map both the inside and outside of the building, creating over 200,000,000 data points. The artist then manipulated the data points with his own custom software to create this public artwork. This is the first time Villareal has used actual data sampled from a location as part of an artwork. Leo Villareal, “Point Cloud (ASU)” is part of the ASU Art Museum’s Halle Public Art Initiative and is generously supported by The Diane and Bruce Halle Foundation with additional funding by the Herberger Institute Dean’s Creativity Council and organized in collaboration with ASU's Roden Crater Initiative. It was produced as a collaboration between the ASU Art Museum and the Los Angeles County Art Museum (LACMA).Image credit: Leo Villareal, “Point Cloud (ASU),” 2020, 12’ 10” x 3’ 3” x 1’ 1”, LEDs, custom software, electrical hardware, steel. Image courtesy of the artist.
node.image_alt: Image credit: Leo Villareal, “Point Cloud (ASU),” 2020, 12’ 10” x 3’ 3” x 1’ 1”, LEDs, custom software, electrical hardware, steel. Image courtesy of the artist.
node.image_title: Image credit: Leo Villareal, “Point Cloud (ASU),” 2020, 12’ 10” x 3’ 3” x 1’ 1”, LEDs, custom software, electrical hardware, steel. Image courtesy of the artist.

node.title: Virtual Drop-In Career and Internship Advising
node.full_body: No appointment needed! Virtual Drop-in Career and Internship Advising is available and our staff is here to assist you in your career journey. We can review resumes and cover letters, help with job/internship search questions and more!Virtual drop-ins will be hosted on Zoom — be sure to see the specific link listed in the location section of the event.Here are some tips to ensure a smooth drop-in process:Please only use the Zoom app on your phone or the Zoom link on your computer/laptop.Please be patient if there is a small wait!Pay attention to the time zone. All times are MST-Arizona unless otherwise corrected.Have any documents (such as resumes/cover letters) ready on your screen to share them.If you have any questions about Zoom, please visit http://links.asu.edu/studentzoomguide for additional information.Career and Professional Development Services encourages persons with disabilities to participate in our events, programs and activities. If you have any inquiries about accessibility or accommodation, please contact our office at careerservices@asu.edu in advance of your participation or visit.

node.title: Live Well Stadium Yoga: Fall 2021 Series
node.full_body: Live Well Yoga offers free one-hour yoga classes led by a rotating cast of local instructors. Classes are open to ASU and the public. All levels are invited to practice, whether you are a beginner or an expert. Registration is required for each class, but nothing more is needed to participate. We recommend bringing a yoga mat, water and a towel.Live Well Yoga Fall 2021 Series will open to a limited number of in-person guests on Tuesday and Saturday mornings. All Saturday classes will be simultaneously broadcast on Zoom for guests who want to continue their practice from home. In this series, guests will also be able to register for multiple classes at once. Once registered, guests who select in-person classes will receive a personalized confirmation email with details about attending with current safety guidelines.Live Well Yoga is presented by ASU 365 Community Union + Live Well @ ASU.More details at www.asu365communityunion.com.
node.image_alt: Yoga instructor wearing black fitness outfits gather in tree pose on the Sun Deck.
node.image_title: Live Well Stadium Yoga returns Saturday, August 21, 2021.
node.Event Date / Time Description: Tuesdays at 7 a.m. and Saturdays at 9:30 a.m.
node.event_topics: Easy on the wallet|Open to the public|For ASU employees

node.title: New Graduate Exhibition
node.college_unit: School of Art, Herberger Institute for Design and the Arts
node.full_body: Harry Wood Gallery is pleased to present the New Graduate Exhibition, an annual exhibition that features work by incoming MFA students within the School of Art. This group of students from around the world produces works that span across a variety of media and concerns and have come to ASU from different backgrounds, disciplines and locales. Viewed together these works represent a sampling of the multiple areas of focus present within the school: animation, ceramics, intermedia, metals, painting and drawing, photography, printmaking, sculpture, textiles and woods.First-year MFA students: Theodore Beatty, Scott Kamlah, Yee Jae Kim, Bethany Larson, Mehrdad Mirzaie, Miguel Monzon, Godshand Owusu-Appiah, Volha Panco, Jared Peterson, Yvette Serrano, Emma Sobel, Jess Tommeraasen and Danley Walkington.Join the artists for a closing reception on Tuesday, Sep. 7 at 5 p.m., followed by the New Grad Slide Slam at 6:30 p.m. in ART 220. Image: Jess Tommeraasen, Eschara, 2020, MDF, ceramic, paint, 7" x 35" x 2"
node.Event Date / Time Description: Exhibition runs Monday through Friday, Aug. 30 to Sep. 9.
node.event_units: School of Art|Herberger Institute for Design and the Arts
node.event_map_title: Art Building, 900 S. Forest Mall, Room 120, Tempe, AZ 85281

node.title: Workshop on Reimagining Climate Futures
node.college_unit: Center for Science and the Imagination
node.full_body: Join the Center for Science and the Imagination (CSI), the Journal of Science Policy & Governance (JSPG) and the UK Science and Innovation Network for a workshop that brings together innovative thinkers in climate science and provides opportunities to reimagine positive climate futures. This event will feature early career researchers published in a special issue of JSPG on climate-change solutions, and CSI's Climate Imagination Fellows, who are working on stories that inspire positive visions of climate action and resilience.Workshop participants will work in interdisciplinary teams to create their own narratives on climate-policy interventions, focusing on issues including climate migration and displacement, advocacy and coalition-building and transforming institutions and industries.The event will also feature a conversation with Emily Cloke, the British Consul General in Los Angeles, California, whose portfolio includes bolstering scientific cooperation between the U.S. and UK and exploring ways to tackle the climate crisis.
node.image_alt: A landscape illustration of mountains with many wind turbines on them, with a colorful city scene in the distance.
node.event_units: Center for Science and the Imagination

node.title: Working Parents Network (WPN) Monthly Meetings
node.full_body: A free, inclusive, peer-led group for ASU employees with young children ages 5 and under. Working Parents Network serves as an informal opportunity to network and share stories about the joys and challenges of raising children. Being a part of this group can build or extend your network among university colleagues. The time is reserved as an open environment to discuss any topic of interest. Periodically, a guest speaker presents on a child development or parenting topic. Benefits:Learn about available campus and community resources.Network with other ASU parents and caregivers.Share parenting tips and strategies.Enroll:Visit canvas.asu.edu/enroll/GY77DD to join the WPN Canvas group site. The site hosts resources and is the mechanism used for announcements and reminders.Sponsored by the ASU Employee Assistance Office.

node.title: Pre-Health Virtual Fall Welcome
node.full_body: Meet the pre-health advisors, learn more about our office and discover how you can get started preparing for professional school applications. Pre-health advisors will introduce the various careers in healthcare, outline the academic requirements and discuss how to begin to build a resume and timeline to application. The pre-health office serves students interested in pursuing a career in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, veterinary medicine, physician assistant, physical therapy and more. We hope to see you there! Registration is recommended but not required. Note: you will need to be signed in to your MyASU account to access the Zoom link.Career and Professional Development Services encourages persons with disabilities to participate in our events, programs and activities. If you have any inquiries about accessibility or accommodation, please contact Mary Nadarski at mary.nadarski@asu.edu in advance of your participation or visit.

node.title: Good Fences Make Bad Covid Policy: What PPE Can Teach Us
node.college_unit: Center for the Study of Economic Liberty, W. P. Carey School of Business, School of Civic and Economic Thought and Leadership, The College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
node.full_body: During normal times, rules proliferate as we try to solve small problems, and fix problems caused by the solutions. But in emergencies, the frictions caused by rules are made apparent. Is there an opportunity to reconsider some of the bases of the drug licensing process, the right to use and the authority to create restrictions in an otherwise free society?About the SpeakerMichael C. Munger is a Professor of Political Science, and Director of the PPE Certificate Program. His primary research focus is on the functioning of markets, regulations and government institutions. He has taught at Dartmouth College, University of Texas and University of North Carolina (where he was Director of the Master of Public Administration Program), as well as working as a staff economist at the Federal Trade Commission during the Reagan Administration. He is a past President of the Public Choice Society, an international academic society of political scientists and economists with members in 16 countries. He was North American Editor of the journal Public Choice for five years, and is now a Co-Editor of The Independent Review His most recent book is "Tomorrow 3.0: Transaction Costs and the Sharing Economy" (2018).

node.title: Spanish Tutoring and Writing Center (Virtual)
node.college_unit: College of Integrative Sciences and Arts
node.full_body: The Faculty of Languages and Cultures in the College of Integrative Sciences and Arts has expanded its virtual Spanish tutoring to two evenings a week (T, W; 6–8 p.m.) and also now offers expanded assistance for writing, including writing tutoring related to theses and other kinds of writing that graduate students might want help with in Spanish.The help with graduate student writing can be most in-depth on Tuesday evenings, with faculty member Concetta Bondi. Any ASU undergraduate or graduate students who might benefit from Spanish tutoring and writing center help are welcome. Students can reserve appointment times via Eventbrite or “drop in” in the Zoom waiting room during office hours.
node.image_alt: Man adjusting headphones while looking at computer screen
node.image_title: Virtual Spanish Tutoring and Writing Center
node.event_units: College of Integrative Sciences and Arts
